snippet: Letters were sent to two egg producers about salmonella contamination, offering insight as to how the Food and Drug Administration may handle new food safety regulations.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration issues warning letters to large egg producers Midwest Poultry Services and SKS Enterprises Inc, contending that they violated a two-year-old rule aimed at preventing salmonella contamination.
lead_paragraph: Letters were sent to two egg producers about salmonella contamination, offering insight as to how the Food and Drug Administration may handle new food safety regulations.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Warns Two Producers on Egg Safety
headline.main: F.D.A. Warns 2 Producers on Egg Safety
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Warns 2 Producers On Egg Safety
